page.title: 14GRAPES AT BERE FERRERS
page.content: The vineyard at Bere Ferrers is the only one in Britain to grow vines from cuttings in plastic tunnels.They were two year old plants that had been grown in the open air.The vines are protected by tunnels on either side,the roots spreading to sixty feet to find water.They are fertilised by manure outside the tunnels.Pruning must be done constantly or there is not enough air and defoliating takes place once a year.There are at present nine tunnels with two more on the way. Fermenting stopped last year-too cold.They have been brought up this year to have a secondary ferment and this year'grapes will be put into last year's wine to sweeten it because you cannot add sugar to Common Market wine. These grapes produce a light table wine-a Riesling and a Muscat.
